SENT.plain: Carotid endarterectomy is the procedure most commonly used for the treatment of lesions in the internal carotid artery
It is occasionally also necessary to insert an internal shunt
After surgery, the patient should be kept in intensive care for 24 h
The most serious complication that can occur is a neurological deficit
Endarterectomy of the origin of the vertebral artery is also the most common procedure used at this location
The techniques for treatment of lesions in the supra-aortic trunks are also discussed, as are the procedures used in cerebral revascularization by extra-intracranial anastomosis
